p: Cannabidiol, or CBD is also a common ingredient in cannabis but compared to THC, it is a non-psychoactive and it can potentially reduce the effects of THC (Klein et al. 2011). CBD does not bind to the same receptors as THC does in the human body and it works by inhibiting FAAH or the enzyme fatty acid amide hydroxyls (see footnote 7). This enzyme is responsible for degrading anadamide in the body and by inhibiting FAAH, CBD increases natural endocannabinoids already in the human system (Klein et al. 2011). CBD is thus an agent that works for depression, anxiety and neuroprotective effects (Klein et al. 2011).
